dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: So here you are, Mark! Will you attend my ascension ceremony? Hector and everyone else is coming... What? These clothes? I look silly, don't I. Formal dress is so stiff, I can't stand it... Ah... Everything's finally resolved. I'll succeed my father as Marquess Pherae. I don't know if I'm equal to the task, but I'm going to do my best for all the people who live here. Mark, you... Do you really have to go? No, I understand. I'm sure that you have things you must do. Thank you for supporting me in everything.

dialogue.speaker: Ninian
dialogue.line: ...Lord Eliwood?

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: Here I am, Ninian!

dialogue.speaker: Ninian
dialogue.line: Ah, hello, Mark. Um, Lord Eliwood, is Mark...

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: Mark will be at the ceremony of ascension but must leave shortly thereafter.

dialogue.speaker: Ninian
dialogue.line: Is that so? I’m disappointed.

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: Oh, Mark, I want you to know something. When things are a little more settled, Ninian and I plan to be married. And...this may be a bit premature but, Mark, we’d like you to name our first child. Ninian and I talked it over. You’ve done so much for us and we truly want this.

dialogue.speaker: Ninian
dialogue.line: Please, Mark.
...Eliwood? Where are you?

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: I'm over here, Lyndis.

dialogue.speaker: Lyn
dialogue.line: Oh, Mark! You're here, too. So, Eliwood, have you spoken to Mark?

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: Mark will be at the ceremony of ascension but must leave shortly thereafter.

dialogue.speaker: Lyn
dialogue.line: Oh, no... Really? That's too bad.

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: Oh, Mark, I want you to know something. When things are a little more settled, Lyndis and I plan to be married. And...this may be premature but, Mark, we'd like you to name our first child. Lyndis and I talked it over. You've done so much for us and we truly want this.

dialogue.speaker: Lyn
dialogue.line: Please, Mark.

dialogue.speaker: Fiora
dialogue.line: ...Lord Eliwood?

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: I'm over here, Fiora!

dialogue.speaker: Fiora
dialogue.line: Oh, and you're here too, Mark. So, ...Lord Eliwood, is Mark...

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: Mark will be at the ceremony of ascension but must leave shortly thereafter.

dialogue.speaker: Fiora
dialogue.line: Is that so? How disappointing...

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: Oh, Mark, I want you to know something. When things are a little more settled, Fiora and I plan to be married. And...this may be a bit premature but, Mark, we'd like you to name our first child. Fiora and I talked it over. You've done so much for us and we truly want this.

dialogue.speaker: Fiora
dialogue.line: Please, Mark.

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: So, Mark, this is farewell. If it weren't for you, I wouldn't... This world wouldn't be here. You have my heartfelt gratitude. Mark... I'll see you again. It's a promise...my friend.

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: Eliwood!

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: Hector! You came.

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: Of course. It’s my friend’s gala occasion. I wouldn’t miss it for the world. Are you ready for this?

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: Yes... I think I am. I’ll succeed my father as Marquess Pherae. I don’t know if I’m equal to the task, but I’m going to do my best for all the people who live here.

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: You’ll be just fine. You’ll be a marquess to rival your father. I guarantee it.

dialogue.speaker: Ninian
dialogue.line: ...Lord Eliwood?

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: I’m over here, Ninian!

dialogue.speaker: Ninian
dialogue.line: Ah...Lord Hector. It’s nice to see you, again.

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: Oh, and here is Marquess Pherae’s wife. I’m happy for you, Ninian. Standing there together, you make a handsome couple.

dialogue.speaker: Ninian
dialogue.line: Oh...thank you...

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: So tell me, Eliwood, when can we expect an heir?

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: He-Hector!

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: Ha ha... It’s nothing to be embarrassed about!

dialogue.speaker: Lyn
dialogue.line: ...Eliwood? Where are you?

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: Over here, Lyndis!

dialogue.speaker: Lyn
dialogue.line: Well, if it isn’t Hector!

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: Oh, and here is Marquess Pherae’s wife. I’m happy for you, Lyn. Standing there together, you make a handsome couple.

dialogue.speaker: Lyn
dialogue.line: Thank you, Hector.

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: Oh, and Eliwood, be careful not to make her mad, or she’ll let you have it!

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: He-Hector!

dialogue.speaker: Lyn
dialogue.line: That’s enough out of you!

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: Ha ha ha!

dialogue.speaker: Fiora
dialogue.line: Lord Eliwood?

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: Over here, Fiora.

dialogue.speaker: Fiora
dialogue.line: Hello, Lord Hector. It’s nice to see you again.

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: Oh, and here is Marquess Pherae’s wife. I’m happy for you, Fiora. Standing there together, you make a handsome couple.

dialogue.speaker: Fiora
dialogue.line: Thank you, Lord Hector.

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: But you know, I never expected you two to be wed at all. During our journey, what were you two doing when I wasn’t around?

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: He-Hector!

dialogue.speaker: Fiora
dialogue.line: I... I did nothing...

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: Ha ha...I’m joking! Joking!!

dialogue.speaker: Marcus
dialogue.line: I beg your pardon. Lord Eliwood, it’s time.

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: Oh, thank you, Marcus.

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: Get going, Eliwood. Lady Eleanora and the people of Pherae are waiting to see you. As, no doubt, is your father. You are the guardian of Pherae’s future now, Marquess.

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: Mm!

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: Oh, Mark! You made it! Come, relax! ...What? You came to say good-bye? I haven’t seen you in so long, and you’re leaving? Hm? Oh, you heard, too? Now that word of my brother’s death has spread, the throne can’t be left empty forever. Being the leader of all Lycia doesn’t really suit me... My brother let me play around for quite a while. If I don’t grow up soon, my brother won’t be able to rest. The burdens Uther carried as Marquess Ostia, his feelings for the citizenry of Ostia and all of Lycia... I’ll succeed him at everything. Easy to say, but I’m sure it’s going to be difficult.

dialogue.speaker: Florina
dialogue.line: Lord Hector... Ah... Mark... It’s nice to see you again.

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: Ah, but Mark’s not here for long though. Some friend, eh?

dialogue.speaker: Florina
dialogue.line: Is... Is that so? Ah... Uh, Mark... I... We...

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: Oh, out with it! I’ll ask for you. Just say it.

dialogue.speaker: Florina
dialogue.line: O-OK... That’s not...

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: Listen, Mark. We’ve got a favor to ask of you. This may seem somewhat premature, but would you be our first child’s godparent?

dialogue.speaker: Florina
dialogue.line: P-Please... He-Hector and I... We would never have met were it not for you, Mark.

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: If it’s a boy, we’re going to name him Uther, after my brother. I’ll teach him how to fight and raise him to be a strong man. We’ll pit him against Eliwood’s son to see who’s the strongest.

dialogue.speaker: Florina
dialogue.line: Um... So, Mark... If it’s a girl...

dialogue.speaker: Lyn
dialogue.line: Hector...Well if it isn’t Mark! It’s been a long time.

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: Ah, but Mark’s not here for long though Some friend, eh?

dialogue.speaker: Lyn
dialogue.line: Oh... That’s too bad. Oh yes, Mark! We’ve a favor to ask of you. It’s a little bit premature, but... Would you be our first child’s godparent? You are the patron to our romance after all.

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: Name? We’ve already decided on that. We’re going to name him Uther after my brother. ...I beg your pardon? What if it’s a girl? It’s my child. It will be a boy! We’ll pit him against Eliwood’s son to see who’s the strongest.

dialogue.speaker: Lyn
dialogue.line: This is all he ever talks about. Honestly, I don’t know if he’ll ever grow up. So, Mark, if it is a girl...

dialogue.speaker: Farina
dialogue.line: Lord Hector... Oh, is that you, Mark? Wow! It’s been such a long time!

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: Right? But Mark’s not here for long though. Some friend, eh?

dialogue.speaker: Farina
dialogue.line: Hmm... Is that true? Oh yes, Mark! We’ve a favor to ask. It may seem a little premature, but would you be our first child’s godparent? I mean if you hadn’t insisted, Hector might not have hired me. If you think about it, we owe everything to you, Mark.

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: Name? We’ve already decided on that. We’re going to name him Uther after my brother. ...I beg your pardon? What if it’s a girl? It’s my child. It will be a boy! We’ll pit him against Eliwood’s son to see who’s the strongest.

dialogue.speaker: Farina
dialogue.line: Did you get that, Mark? I would like to have a girl, of course. Now, if we do have a girl...

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: Are you leaving? Say, Mark, do you remember Athos’s final words? I sealed Armads away, like it used to be, but... I can still feel its power pulsing inside me. War is coming. Someday, a terrible war... When that day comes... I want you to be there when that day comes. I want you to guide my children and me.

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: We’ll meet again. I’m sure of it!

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: Hey, Eliwood! You made it.

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: I would never turn down an invitation from you. So, are you ready? You once told me being the leader of Lycia wasn’t for you.

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: Well...yes. Now that word of my brother’s death has spread, the throne can’t be left empty forever. My brother let me play around for quite a while. If I don’t grow up soon, he may start screaming at me from the grave.

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: Ha ha! You’re probably right.

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: The burdens Uther carried as Marquess Ostia, his feelings for the citizenry of Ostia and all of Lycia... I’ll succeed him at everything. Easy to say, but I’m sure it’s going to be difficult.

dialogue.speaker: Lyn
dialogue.line: Hector... Well, if it isn’t Eliwood!

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: Well met, Lyndis. You’ve grown even more fair than when I saw you last.

dialogue.speaker: Lyn
dialogue.line: Oh... Did you hear that, Hector. That’s the biggest difference between you and Eliwood.

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: Give me a break.

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: Hector may not say it, but more than anyone else, that is what he thinks. Isn’t that so, Hector?

dialogue.speaker: Lyn
dialogue.line: Really?

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: Eliwood! You...

dialogue.speaker: Farina
dialogue.line: Lord Hector... Hm? Is that you, Lord Eliwood? Wah! It’s been such a very long time!

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: Nice to see you again, Farina. We didn’t have too many chances to talk during our journey, but...

dialogue.speaker: Farina
dialogue.line: That’s true.

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: Well, you’ll have plenty of opportunity from now on. Let me introduce you... This here’s the 20,000 gold woman.

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: Huh?

dialogue.speaker: Farina
dialogue.line: Hold it! Are you still angry about that? That was a reasonable sum, and it included hazard pay!

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: Hm?

dialogue.speaker: Florina
dialogue.line: Lord Hector... Ah... Lord Eliwood... It’s, um, nice to see you again.

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: Hello, Florina. Have you grown used to life here in Ostia?

dialogue.speaker: Florina
dialogue.line: Yes, yes...

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: Truly? You still get tongue-tied in front of crowds.

dialogue.speaker: Florina
dialogue.line: Ye-Yes...

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: As the wife of Marquess Ostia, you must be able to speak in public. That has me somewhat worried.

dialogue.speaker: Florina
dialogue.line: I-I’m sorry... I’ll...do...better... Sniff...

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: OK! OK! I understand, so don’t cry! It’s all my fault! Please!

dialogue.speaker: Florina
dialogue.line: OK...

dialogue.speaker: Oswin
dialogue.line: I beg your pardon. Lord Hector, shall we?

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: Yeah, OK. Say, Eliwood, do you remember old Athos Graybeard’s final words?

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: Of course.

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: I sealed Armads away, like it used to be, but... I can still feel its power pulsing inside me. War is coming. Someday, a terrible war... When that day comes...

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: Mm, I understand. When it comes, we’ll fight together. For our future and for our children’s.

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: Thanks for coming, Eliwood!

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: Hector! Long time, no see!

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: First time since my brother's funeral--fifteen years now. And look at us. We've both grown older, haven't we?

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: Uh-huh. Time certainly does speed right by. My father's disappearance...his death...the fight with Nergal...those fire dragons... The memories are so vivid, it might have happened yesterday.

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: Nergal... What a blackheart he was. I've had enough of battles like that. Hm? Is that your son over there?

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: I've been wanting to introduce you, but there's been no chance. Roy! Come here!

dialogue.speaker: Roy
dialogue.line: Did you need something, Father?

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: Say hello to Marquess Ostia!

dialogue.speaker: Roy
dialogue.line: Ye-Yes, sir! A pleasure to meet you, Lord Hector. My name is Roy.

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: Roy, is it? Nice to meet you, lad. Well, I guess that means I should introduce my daughter then! Lilina!

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: What? Are you being shy? You don't have to be nervous. This is your father's old friend and his son.

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: Hello, Lilina. This is Roy. He's the same age as you.

dialogue.speaker: Lilina
dialogue.line: Nice to meet you...

dialogue.speaker: Roy
dialogue.line: Lilina? Let's be friends. We can play over there.

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: It's OK. Go on.

dialogue.speaker: Lilina
dialogue.line: Ah!

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: What a cute child. Good thing she took after her mother.

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: What? She looks just like me, doesn't she?

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: You're a sarcastic one, Marquess Ostia!

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: Come on, now you're the one putting on airs, Marquess Pherae!

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: Ha ha ha ha! The only thing older about you is your appearance. Don't tell me you still behave like that even now that you're the marquess!

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: I'm always on top of my duties as marquess. But when I'm around you, I want to relax, so, please...

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: Hector... By the way, I heard that the king of Bern died. It was fairly sudden, too.

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: I can't be certain, but according to one of our spies, he was killed in an assassination attempt on Prince Zephiel.

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: The prince? I trust he was unharmed.

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: It's a strange tale... At first, I'd heard that the prince was killed. Then new information came three days later saying that it was the king who had died.

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: Do you remember Archsage Athos's prediction? Is something happening in Bern?

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: I don't know.

dialogue.speaker: Lilina
dialogue.line: Father! Can I show Roy my pony?

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: Yes, go ahead. Be careful!

dialogue.speaker: Lilina
dialogue.line: OK!

dialogue.speaker: Hector
dialogue.line: For the sake of our children's futures, I'll stop anything that may happen. I'll sacrifice my life to make it so.

dialogue.speaker: Eliwood
dialogue.line: "Once again, Lycia brings hope." ...If that turns out to be wrong? No. It must happen...

dialogue.speaker: Enigmatic Man
dialogue.line: For what reason have you awakened a demon dragon?

dialogue.speaker: Zephiel
dialogue.line: Who are you?

dialogue.speaker: Enigmatic Man
dialogue.line: ...Dragon.
